speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: SCENE III. The same. A street.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Enter LAUNCE, leading a dog

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: Nay, 'twill be this hour ere I have done weeping;

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: all the kind of the Launces have this very fault. I

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: have received my proportion, like the prodigious

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: son, and am going with Sir Proteus to the Imperial's

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: court. I think Crab, my dog, be the sourest-natured

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: dog that lives: my mother weeping, my father

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: wailing, my sister crying, our maid howling, our cat

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: wringing her hands, and all our house in a great

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: perplexity, yet did not this cruel-hearted cur shed

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: one tear: he is a stone, a very pebble stone, and

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: has no more pity in him than a dog: a Jew would have

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: wept to have seen our parting; why, my grandam,

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: having no eyes, look you, wept herself blind at my

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: parting. Nay, I'll show you the manner of it. This

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: shoe is my father: no, this left shoe is my father:

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: no, no, this left shoe is my mother: nay, that

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: cannot be so neither: yes, it is so, it is so, it

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: hath the worser sole. This shoe, with the hole in

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: it, is my mother, and this my father; a vengeance

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: on't! there 'tis: now, sit, this staff is my

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: sister, for, look you, she is as white as a lily and

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: as small as a wand: this hat is Nan, our maid: I

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: am the dog: no, the dog is himself, and I am the

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: dog--Oh! the dog is me, and I am myself; ay, so,

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: so. Now come I to my father; Father, your blessing:

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: now should not the shoe speak a word for weeping:

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: now should I kiss my father; well, he weeps on. Now

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: come I to my mother: O, that she could speak now

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: like a wood woman! Well, I kiss her; why, there

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: 'tis; here's my mother's breath up and down. Now

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: come I to my sister; mark the moan she makes. Now

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: the dog all this while sheds not a tear nor speaks a

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: word; but see how I lay the dust with my tears.

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: Enter PANTHINO

speaker: PANTHINO
text_entry: Launce, away, away, aboard! thy master is shipped

speaker: PANTHINO
text_entry: and thou art to post after with oars. What's the

speaker: PANTHINO
text_entry: matter? why weepest thou, man? Away, ass! You'll

speaker: PANTHINO
text_entry: lose the tide, if you tarry any longer.

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: It is no matter if the tied were lost; for it is the

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: unkindest tied that ever any man tied.

speaker: PANTHINO
text_entry: What's the unkindest tide?

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: Why, he that's tied here, Crab, my dog.

speaker: PANTHINO
text_entry: Tut, man, I mean thou'lt lose the flood, and, in

speaker: PANTHINO
text_entry: losing the flood, lose thy voyage, and, in losing

speaker: PANTHINO
text_entry: thy voyage, lose thy master, and, in losing thy

speaker: PANTHINO
text_entry: master, lose thy service, and, in losing thy

speaker: PANTHINO
text_entry: service,--Why dost thou stop my mouth?

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: For fear thou shouldst lose thy tongue.

speaker: PANTHINO
text_entry: Where should I lose my tongue?

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: In thy tale.

speaker: PANTHINO
text_entry: In thy tail!

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: Lose the tide, and the voyage, and the master, and

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: the service, and the tied! Why, man, if the river

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: were dry, I am able to fill it with my tears; if the

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: wind were down, I could drive the boat with my sighs.

speaker: PANTHINO
text_entry: Come, come away, man; I was sent to call thee.

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: Sir, call me what thou darest.

speaker: PANTHINO
text_entry: Wilt thou go?

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: Well, I will go.

speaker: LAUNCE
text_entry: Exeunt
